channel.title: My new app: Third Rock Radio
channel.description:
So last night I discovered NASA official radio station, which is fantastic in all shapes ways and forms except for the fact its built in flash; making it not usable on Android, so I built an android compatible version with a NODEJS backend so the user is doing as little actual streaming as possible (in terms of fetching info from the radio station)
It's pretty simple all around. I hope you enjoy it
[url=https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.codeusasoft.thirdrockradio]https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.codeusasoft.thirdrockradio[/url]
[IMG]https://lh3.ggpht.com/qzRVI-IWZsyOMbvUQZoIu1Zld-qNTWonWDMgOgEEhXuoDRmeLeHZ6T9bUB2-CN3v8UA=h900-rw[/img]
[IMG]https://lh4.ggpht.com/AYfepohfxPN4oL15W0cdqVupBIBd5k_yWffcDLh_Qt1qjGldIpt2m7zF2x9YPHwuY84=h900-rw[/img]

item.title: My new app: Third Rock Radio
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:7, topic:541873”][quote author=Codeusa11 link=topic=660741.msg4417530#msg4417530 date=1396647691]

[quote author=Pwnd link=topic=660741.msg4417477#msg4417477 date=1396624119]

fyi flash is compatible with android and ios.
[/quote]Unless if I’m using an outdated iOS, pretty sure it doesn’t support flash.
[/quote]Android has definitely supported it longer than iOS, so yeah that’s who you should be worried about.

Android flash has been unofficially unsupported by Adobe and Google since 2012. Nor is the apk that floats around compatible with any newer phones; I.E my Samsung Galaxy S4.

And the phones that still have basic flash support have it terribly. Why do you think the official youtube app doesn’t use it?

Addon: Flash support dropped as of Android 4.1 (Jellybean) and cannot even be installed without workarounds. Even then it is very poor.[/quote]Makin’ that HTML5 move

Read full topic
item.source: My new app: Third Rock Radio
